verses.kjv: Now in the twelfth month, that is, the month Adar, on the thirteenth day of the same, when the king’s commandment and his decree drew near to be put in execution, in the day that the enemies of the Jews hoped to have power over them, (though it was turned to the contrary, that the Jews had rule over them that hated them;)
verses.ct: On the 13th day of the 12th month, the month of Adar, the day arrived when the king's command and decree were to be carried out. This was the day the enemies of the Jews had expected to overpower them, but the situation was completely reversed — the Jews gained the upper hand over those who hated them.

verses.kjv: The Jews gathered themselves together in their cities throughout all the provinces of the king Ahasuerus, to lay hand on such as sought their hurt: and no man could withstand them; for the fear of them fell upon all people.
verses.ct: Throughout every province of King Ahasuerus, the Jews assembled in their cities to attack those who were trying to destroy them. No one could stand against them, because everyone was terrified of them.

verses.kjv: And all the rulers of the provinces, and the lieutenants, and the deputies, and officers of the king, helped the Jews; because the fear of Mordecai fell upon them.
verses.ct: All the provincial governors, regional officials, deputies, and royal administrators supported the Jews, because they were all afraid of Mordecai.

verses.kjv: For Mordecai was great in the king’s house, and his fame went out throughout all the provinces: for this man Mordecai waxed greater and greater.
verses.ct: Mordecai had become powerful in the king's court, and his reputation spread throughout all the provinces, because his influence kept growing stronger and stronger.

verses.kjv: Thus the Jews smote all their enemies with the stroke of the sword, and slaughter, and destruction, and did what they would unto those that hated them.
verses.ct: The Jews struck down all their enemies with swords, killing and destroying them, and did whatever they wanted to those who hated them.

verses.kjv: And in Shushan the palace the Jews slew and destroyed five hundred men.
verses.ct: In the fortress of Shushan alone, the Jews killed and destroyed 500 men.

verses.kjv: And Parshandatha, and Dalphon, and Aspatha,
verses.ct: They also killed Parshandatha, Dalphon, Aspatha,

verses.kjv: And Poratha, and Adalia, and Aridatha,
verses.ct: Poratha, Adalia, Aridatha,

verses.kjv: And Parmashta, and Arisai, and Aridai, and Vajezatha,
verses.ct: Parmashta, Arisai, Aridai, and Vajezatha —

verses.kjv: The ten sons of Haman the son of Hammedatha, the enemy of the Jews, slew they; but on the spoil laid they not their hand.
verses.ct: the 10 sons of Haman son of Hammedatha, the enemy of the Jews. However, the Jews did not take any of their possessions.

verses.kjv: On that day the number of those that were slain in Shushan the palace was brought before the king.
verses.ct: That same day, the number of people killed in the fortress of Shushan was reported to the king.

verses.kjv: And the king said unto Esther the queen, The Jews have slain and destroyed five hundred men in Shushan the palace, and the ten sons of Haman; what have they done in the rest of the king’s provinces? now what is thy petition? and it shall be granted thee: or what is thy request further? and it shall be done.
verses.ct: The king said to Queen Esther, "The Jews have killed and destroyed 500 men in the fortress of Shushan, along with Haman's 10 sons. Imagine what they must have done in the rest of the royal provinces! Now, what else do you want? It will be given to you. What more do you ask for? It will be done."

verses.kjv: Then said Esther, If it please the king, let it be granted to the Jews which are in Shushan to do to morrow also according unto this day’s decree, and let Haman’s ten sons be hanged upon the gallows.
verses.ct: Esther replied, "If it pleases the king, allow the Jews in Shushan to carry out tomorrow's actions under the same decree as today, and let the bodies of Haman's 10 sons be hung on the gallows."

verses.kjv: And the king commanded it so to be done: and the decree was given at Shushan; and they hanged Haman’s ten sons.
verses.ct: The king ordered that this be done. The decree was issued in Shushan, and they hung the bodies of Haman's 10 sons.

verses.kjv: For the Jews that were in Shushan gathered themselves together on the fourteenth day also of the month Adar, and slew three hundred men at Shushan; but on the prey they laid not their hand.
verses.ct: The Jews in Shushan assembled again on the 14th day of the month of Adar and killed 300 more men in Shushan, but they did not take any of their possessions.

verses.kjv: But the other Jews that were in the king’s provinces gathered themselves together, and stood for their lives, and had rest from their enemies, and slew of their foes seventy and five thousand, but they laid not their hands on the prey,
verses.ct: The rest of the Jews throughout the king's provinces also assembled and defended their lives. They found relief from their enemies and killed 75,000 of those who hated them, but they did not take any of their possessions.

verses.kjv: On the thirteenth day of the month Adar; and on the fourteenth day of the same rested they, and made it a day of feasting and gladness.
verses.ct: This happened on the 13th day of the month of Adar. On the 14th day they rested and made it a day of celebration and joy.

verses.kjv: But the Jews that were at Shushan assembled together on the thirteenth day thereof, and on the fourteenth thereof; and on the fifteenth day of the same they rested, and made it a day of feasting and gladness.
verses.ct: But the Jews in Shushan had assembled on both the 13th and the 14th days, so they rested on the 15th day and made that their day of celebration and joy.

verses.kjv: Therefore the Jews of the villages, that dwelt in the unwalled towns, made the fourteenth day of the month Adar a day of gladness and feasting, and a good day, and of sending portions one to another.
verses.ct: That is why the Jews living in rural areas and unwalled towns celebrate the 14th day of the month of Adar as a day of joy, celebration, and feasting, and as a day for sending gifts of food to one another.

verses.kjv: And Mordecai wrote these things, and sent letters unto all the Jews that were in all the provinces of the king Ahasuerus, both nigh and far,
verses.ct: Mordecai recorded all of these events and sent letters to every Jewish person in all the provinces of King Ahasuerus, both near and far,

verses.kjv: To stablish this among them, that they should keep the fourteenth day of the month Adar, and the fifteenth day of the same, yearly,
verses.ct: establishing that they should celebrate the 14th and 15th days of the month of Adar every year

verses.kjv: As the days wherein the Jews rested from their enemies, and the month which was turned unto them from sorrow to joy, and from mourning into a good day: that they should make them days of feasting and joy, and of sending portions one to another, and gifts to the poor.
verses.ct: as the days when the Jews gained relief from their enemies, and the month when their sorrow was turned into joy and their mourning into celebration. They were to observe these as days of feasting and joy, sending gifts of food to one another and giving presents to the poor.

verses.kjv: And the Jews undertook to do as they had begun, and as Mordecai had written unto them;
verses.ct: The Jews agreed to continue what they had already started doing, just as Mordecai had written to them.

verses.kjv: Because Haman the son of Hammedatha, the Agagite, the enemy of all the Jews, had devised against the Jews to destroy them, and had cast Pur, that is, the lot, to consume them, and to destroy them;
verses.ct: This was because Haman son of Hammedatha, the Agagite, the enemy of all the Jews, had plotted to destroy them. He had cast the Pur — that is, the lot — to crush and annihilate them.

verses.kjv: But when Esther came before the king, he commanded by letters that his wicked device, which he devised against the Jews, should return upon his own head, and that he and his sons should be hanged on the gallows.
verses.ct: But when Esther went before the king, he issued written orders that Haman's evil scheme against the Jews should be turned back on his own head, and that he and his sons should be hung on the gallows.

verses.kjv: Wherefore they called these days Purim after the name of Pur. Therefore for all the words of this letter, and of that which they had seen concerning this matter, and which had come unto them,
verses.ct: That is why these days are called Purim, from the word Pur. Because of everything written in this letter, and because of what they had experienced and what had happened to them,

verses.kjv: The Jews ordained, and took upon them, and upon their seed, and upon all such as joined themselves unto them, so as it should not fail, that they would keep these two days according to their writing, and according to their appointed time every year;
verses.ct: the Jews established and committed themselves, their descendants, and everyone who joined them to celebrate these 2 days every year without fail, at the appointed time and in the prescribed way.

verses.kjv: And that these days should be remembered and kept throughout every generation, every family, every province, and every city; and that these days of Purim should not fail from among the Jews, nor the memorial of them perish from their seed.
verses.ct: These days were to be remembered and observed in every generation, every family, every province, and every city. These days of Purim were never to disappear from among the Jews, and the memory of them was never to fade from their descendants.

verses.kjv: Then Esther the queen, the daughter of Abihail, and Mordecai the Jew, wrote with all authority, to confirm this second letter of Purim.
verses.ct: Then Queen Esther, the daughter of Abihail, along with Mordecai the Jew, wrote with full authority to confirm this second letter about Purim.

verses.kjv: And he sent the letters unto all the Jews, to the hundred twenty and seven provinces of the kingdom of Ahasuerus, with words of peace and truth,
verses.ct: Letters were sent to all the Jews in the 127 provinces of the kingdom of Ahasuerus, with messages of peace and truth,

verses.kjv: To confirm these days of Purim in their times appointed, according as Mordecai the Jew and Esther the queen had enjoined them, and as they had decreed for themselves and for their seed, the matters of the fastings and their cry.
verses.ct: to establish these days of Purim at their appointed times, just as Mordecai the Jew and Queen Esther had directed them, and just as they had committed themselves and their descendants to observe the practices of fasting and mourning.

verses.kjv: And the decree of Esther confirmed these matters of Purim; and it was written in the book.
verses.ct: Esther's decree confirmed these regulations about Purim, and it was recorded in the official records.
